descr.p: This chapter describes the STRINGS unit for Free Pascal. This unit is system independent, and therefore works on all supported platforms.

element.name: StrAlloc
element.short: Allocate memory for a new null-terminated string on the heap
element.descr: StrAlloc reserves memory on the heap for a string with length Len, terminating #0 included, and returns a pointer to it.
element.errors: If there is not enough memory, a run-time error occurs.

element.name: StrCat
element.short: Concatenate 2 null-terminated strings.
element.descr: Attaches Source to Dest and returns Dest.

element.name: StrComp
element.short: Compare 2 null-terminated strings, case sensitive.

descr.p: Compares the null-terminated strings S1 and S2. The result is

element.name: StrCopy
element.short: Copy a null-terminated string
element.descr: Copy the null terminated string in Source to Dest, and returns a pointer to Dest. Dest needs enough room to contain Source, i.e. StrLen(Source)+1 bytes.

element.name: StrDispose
element.short: disposes of a null-terminated string on the heap
element.descr: Removes the string in P from the heap and releases the memory.

element.name: StrECopy
element.short: Copy a null-terminated string, return a pointer to the end.
element.descr: Copies the Null-terminated string in Source to Dest, and returns a pointer to the end (i.e. the terminating Null-character) of the copied string.

element.name: StrEnd
element.short: Return a pointer to the end of a null-terminated string
element.descr: Returns a pointer to the end of P. (i.e. to the terminating null-character.

element.name: StrIComp
element.short: Compare 2 null-terminated strings, case insensitive.

descr.p: Compares the null-terminated strings S1 and S2, ignoring case. The result is

element.name: StrLCat
element.short: Concatenate 2 null-terminated strings, with length boundary.
element.descr: Adds MaxLen characters from Source to Dest, and adds a terminating null-character. Returns Dest.

element.name: StrLComp
element.short: Compare limited number of characters of 2 null-terminated strings

descr.p: Compares maximum L characters of the null-terminated strings S1 and S2. The result is

element.name: StrLCopy
element.short: Copy a null-terminated string, limited in length.
element.descr: Copies MaxLen characters from Source to Dest, and makes Dest a null terminated string.

element.name: StrLen
element.short: Length of a null-terminated string.
element.descr: Returns the length of the null-terminated string P.

element.name: StrLIComp
element.short: Compare limited number of characters in 2 null-terminated strings, ignoring case.

descr.p: Compares maximum L characters of the null-terminated strings S1 and S2, ignoring case. The result is

element.name: StrLower
element.short: Convert null-terminated string to all-lowercase.
element.descr: Converts P to an all-lowercase string. Returns P.

element.name: StrMove
element.short: Move a null-terminated string to new location.
element.descr: Copies MaxLen characters from Source to Dest. No terminating null-character is copied. Returns Dest

element.name: StrNew
element.short: Allocate room for new null-terminated string.
element.descr: Copies P to the Heap, and returns a pointer to the copy.
element.errors: Returns Nil if no memory was available for the copy.

element.name: StrPas
element.short: Convert a null-terminated string to a shortstring.
element.descr: Converts a null terminated string in P to a Pascal string, and returns this string. The string is truncated at 255 characters.

element.name: StrPCopy
element.short: Copy a pascal string to a null-terminated string
element.descr: Converts the Pascal string in Source to a Null-terminated string, and copies it to Dest. Dest needs enough room to contain the string Source, i.e. Length(Source)+1 bytes.

element.name: StrPos
element.short: Search for a null-terminated substring in a null-terminated string
element.descr: Returns a pointer to the first occurrence of S2 in S1. If S2 does not occur in S1, returns Nil.

element.name: StrRScan
element.short: Find last occurrence of a character in a null-terminated string.

descr.p: Returns a pointer to the last occurrence of the character C in the null-terminated string P. If C does not occur, returns Nil.

element.name: StrScan
element.short: Find first occurrence of a character in a null-terminated string.
element.descr: Returns a pointer to the first occurrence of the character C in the null-terminated string P. If C does not occur, returns Nil.

element.name: StrUpper
element.short: Convert null-terminated string to all-uppercase

descr.p: Converts P to an all-uppercase string. Returns P.
